Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about Harry Potter and the Cursed Child's ticket sales revenue for both Broadway and West End productions. Here's what I discovered:

## Broadway Revenue and Performance

The Tony-winning play has sold more than 10 million tickets worldwide since its July 2016 premiere and is Broadway's most successful non-musical play with more than $330 million in total sales.(no content)In December 2018, Cursed Child set a new record for highest weekly ticket sales by a play at $2.5 million.(no content)The New York Times estimated that it was the most expensive non-musical Broadway play ever, incurring approximately $68 million in opening costs.

## Ticket Pricing and Sales Information

The Broadway production offers various pricing tiers:
- Every week we release a limited number of $40 Cursed Child tickets for the following week's performances.
- Subject to availability, there will be $49 tickets for purchase for that day's performance, only available in-person when the Lyric Theatre box office on 214 W 43rd St opens at 10am each day.
- Tickets for Harry Potter and the Cursed Child start at $75.

## Global Ticket Sales

Across all its productions worldwide, Harry Potter and the Cursed Child has sold over 6 million tickets. The play has expanded internationally with productions in multiple countries including Canada, Japan, Australia, and Germany.

## Awards and Recognition

Winner of 6 Tony Awards®, including best play, and The show won a record-breaking nine Olivier Awards in London, including Best New Play, and Harry Potter and the Cursed Child in New York won six Tonys, including Best Play.

The production has been particularly successful financially, establishing itself as a major commercial success in both the West End and on Broadway, with the Broadway version becoming the highest-grossing non-musical play in Broadway history.
